DataElement.preferredName: Person Malignant Neoplasm Detection Evaluation Method Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response for questions to determine patient eligibility for clinical trial participation, as outlined in the study protocol, that address evaluation procedures and methods used to identify malignant neoplastic disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Malignant Neoplasm Detection Evaluation Method Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the method or test used to determine the presence of a malignant neoplastic tumor as information that can be used to judge response to treatment as an element of a personal medical history which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Detection Evaluation Method Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004:The activity of perceiving, discerning, discovering or identifying.:Evaluation; the act of placing value on something.:A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
The act of perceiving, discerning, discovering, or identifying.
Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.
A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have one of the following confirmed histologically, cytologically, or through biochemical testing: wild-type GIST (GIST without KIT or PDGFRA mutation); PHEO/PGL with a germline mutation in SDHA, SDHB, SDHC, or SDHD; or renal cell cancer associated with HLRCC?

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient is in cohort 2 (Co
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is in cohort 2 (Colorectal cohort), does patient have MSS tumor as documented by either: IHC testing that does not suggest loss of MLH-1, MSH-2, PMS2 or MSH6 OR PCR testing that does not suggest MSI?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is registered to Dose Expansion Part 2 and has colorectal cancer, does patient have MSS expression detected by an accredited laboratory per local process?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is enrolled in Cohort 1, has presence of a mutation in KRAS been detected by a by a CLIA-approved assay?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is enrolled in Cohort 1, has presence of a mutation in KRAS been detected by a CLIA-approved assay?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient in Cohort 1, have CLIA testing and fit the group with the confirmed presence of a cancer-associated alteration considered pathogenic/likely pathogenic by FM and/or the Genetics Review Panel in one or more of the following genes: BRCA1, BRCA2, ATM, BAP1, MSH2, PALB2, and BRIP1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have locally advanced pancreatic cancer according to NCCN Guidelines (Version 1.2020) on CT scan performed within 28 days of treatment registration and confirmed by central review?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was a CT scan performed after the completion of induction chemotherapy and within 28 days of Registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have locally advanced pancreatic cancer according to NCCN Guidelines (Version 1.2020) on CT scan performed within 21 days of registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: For phase 2: Does patient have colorectal cancer with MGMT promoter hypermethylation positivity on pre-screening of archival tissue?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: For phase 2: Does patient have mismatch repair proficient/microsatellite stable colorectal cancer with MGMT promoter hypermethylation positivity on pre-screening of archival tissue?

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2023.5.3 AQT added per ticket request CADSR0002390. ak
